refnamediv.refpurpose: Add an attribute to the given node of an XML tree document

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The function modifies the source document by adding an attribute to the current node of source entity. The source should be an XML tree entity, not "persistent XML" one, should be an element entity (not attribute, text etc.) and should not be a root entity. Parameters attr_name and attr_value can be of any types that can be casted to string. attr_name can be an attribute entity, in this case both the name and the value of attr_name attribute is used and attr_value code must be omitted.

The mode specifies how to resolve duplicate attribute names, if an source entity already has an attribute whose name is equal to attr_name. Mode 0 is similar to "insert into": the function signals an error if an attribute already exists. Mode 1 is similar to "insert soft": the function do nothing if an attribute already exists and not signalling an error. Mode 2 is similar to "insert replacing": the function either adds a new attribute or replacing the value of existing attribute.

refsect2.title: source
refsect2.para: The XML tree entity to change.

refsect2.title: mode
refsect2.para: The mode of resolving duplicate attribute names.

refsect2.title: attr_name
refsect2.para: The name of a new attribute (or an attribute XML entity that specifies both name and value of an attribute.

refsect2.title: attr_value
refsect2.para: The value of a new attribute

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: The function returns integer that indicate the actual operation performed. The zero value means that there was no change ("insert soft" when an attribute already exists). The value one means that a new attribute was added, the value two means that an existing attribute was replaced.

example.title: Different modes of calling XMLAddAttribute
example.para: The sample procedure contains three calls of XMLAddAttribute with different values of mode, for "insert into", "insert soft" and "insert replacing" behaviour.
